content.body: Are you looking for something like Error Cause? https://github.com/tc39/proposal-error-cause
lol, no that is another proposal that would need to be integrated into an AssertionError
not sure who designed AMP's Expected Error linked above (it is actually kinda neat), but it seems like it is missing an `actual` property
content.formatted_body: not sure who designed AMP's Expected Error linked above (it is actually kinda neat), but it seems like it is missing an actual property

content.body: so.. w/o having both an `actual` & `expected` property standardized in an ECMAScript AssertionError proposal, it doesn't seem like it would be true to its name
content.formatted_body: so.. w/o having both an actual & expected property standardized in an ECMAScript AssertionError proposal, it doesn't seem like it would be true to its name

content.body: What would `actual` be?
content.formatted_body: What would actual be?

content.body: `actual` would be the reality of the situation
content.formatted_body: actual would be the reality of the situation

content.body: Expected errors in AMP are things that we can't fix or work around, eg `localStorage` throwing an error in privacy mode
content.formatted_body: Expected errors in AMP are things that we can't fix or work around, eg localStorage throwing an error in privacy mode

content.body: Certain features depend on `localStorage`, and when it's unavailable there's not a replacement that we can use
content.formatted_body: Certain features depend on localStorage, and when it's unavailable there's not a replacement that we can use

content.body: I think that maps really well with what Error Cause does.
Eg, we'd create an `new ExpectedError("local storage failure", { cause: realLocalStorageError })`
content.formatted_body: Eg, we'd create an new ExpectedError("local storage failure", { cause: realLocalStorageError })

content.body: true, AssertionError is really about comparisons, so one would need to probably come up with a value to represent the unavailability of a feature
